© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
Estimation of Revenue Impact of Growth 
(Inorganic Scaling)
1
• Built a model to estimate the annual incremental revenue for a given increase in 
the network size. 
• Identified growth potential across different segments of the current network 
and quantified the revenue impact of growth across the segments.
Patient Engagement Solutions Company

© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
Accordion Value Add 
•
Developed a bottoms-up financial model to estimate revenue impact from inorganic expansion based on contract type and client segment. 
•
Helped identify product line segments with high revenue growth opportunities for potential network expansion.
•
Provided flexibility for end users, including the sales team, to customize contract expansion probability based on specific customers or specialties sales 
insights.
•
Created a standardized repository of contract information by consolidating data from multiple sources to facilitate additional analytical models.
Situation
•
The client wanted to understand the growth potential and revenue impact of inorganic network expansion across different client segments.
•
Partnered with the client to build a robust analytical model to quantify revenue impact of inorganic expansion based on overall network, client segment and 
product line growth scenarios.
Analyzing Revenue Impact of Inorganic Growth For a Patient 
Engagement Company
2
Impact
•
The incremental revenue estimates based on different network growth scenarios helped make critical decisions in post acquisition planning and financial 
projections.
•
The revenue impact model helped the client identify optimal network growth for different segments of the network.
Estimation of Revenue Impact of 
Growth (Inorganic Scaling)

© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
Model Approach and Methodology (1/2)
Users provided input for ‘Network Growth’ & Sales team provided input on ‘Probability of Contract Expansion’ 
Contract Expansion Probability- Sales team to customize 
probability of contract expansion at a segment or at a 
contract level
Network Growth Factor- User inputs captured for 
customizing network growth for different segments
Capture User Inputs 
for Customizability

1
Classification of 
Contracts
Classification of contracts is based on contracted inventory
Full Network Contracts- All available 
inventory in given segment contracted 
by customer
Budget/Minimum Contracts- 
Budgetary limitations and/or minimum 
buy
List Match Contracts- List of desired 
inventory provided by customer
Identification of 
Unfulfilled Demand 
for each contract
Growth Potential of contracts is estimated based on contract type 
Budget/Minimum Contracts- No 
growth potential
Full Network Contracts- Will buy all 
additional inventory in respective 
segment 
List Match Contracts- Will buy 
additional inventory in respective 
segment if it falls in the list of desired 
inventory

probability of contract expansion at a segment or contract 
level

customizing network growth for different segments

Model Approach and Methodology (2/2)
Data Consolidation: A single source of data was missing. Gathering data gathering from multiple sources to establish a standard repository was a key challenge. 
5
Revenue impact of growth is estimated at a contract level and then aggregated across different segments
Revenue Impact of Growth = [Incremental Contracted Inventory] x [Avg. Price Per Month]*[Number of Months] 
Output
Estimating 
Incremental 
Contracted 
Inventory
Incremental contracted inventory is estimated at a contract level and is based on growth potential, network growth factors, and contract 
expansion probability
Full Network Contracts - Incremental contracted inventory is 
assumed to grow proportionally with the increase in network 
size
List Match Contracts - Incremental contracted inventory is 
assumed to grow proportionally with network size; subject to 
additional conditions involving initial inventory lists provided 
by the customer
